alert.note: Alert for Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 05 at 11:51AM EDT until September 05 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN WINDHAM, SOUTHEASTERN WORCESTER AND NORTHWESTERN PROVIDENCE COUNTIES... At 1151 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain moving into northeast Connecticut and northwest Rhode Island. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen as heavy rain moved through portions of central Massachusetts. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Woonsocket, Killingly, Webster, Southbridge, Bellingham, Burrillville, Oxford, Uxbridge, North Smithfield, Dudley, Glocester, Putnam, Thompson, Blackstone, Sutton, Douglas, Woodstock, Pomfret and Millville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
